Package net.nergi.util

Class Either<L,​R>

Object
Either<L,​R>
Type Parameters:
L - Type held by Left instance.
R - Type held by Right instance.
public abstract class Either<L,​R>
extends Object
A two-state class. Typically used in functional programming for handling exceptions by separating which class instance holds what.

Typically, Right is used to hold the result of successful operations, and Left is used to hold exceptions or other errors that occur during an operation.

A consequence of this is that one cannot use var as the JVM will not be able to infer the other type than the one given.

  • Method Details

    • leftFrom

      public static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> leftFrom​(L item)
      Make a new Left instance with the given item held inside.
      Type Parameters:
      L - Type of item held by Left instance
      R - The potential type of the Right instance
      Parameters:
      item - Item held in Left instance
      Returns:
      A Left-Either instance.

    • rightFrom

      public static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> rightFrom​(R item)
      Make a new Right instance with the given item held inside.
      Type Parameters:
      L - The potential type of the Left instance
      R - Type of item held by Right instance
      Parameters:
      item - Item held in Right instance
      Returns:
      A Right-Either instance.

    • isLeft

      public boolean isLeft()
      Is this a Left-Either instance?
      Returns:
      Whether this is a Left-Either instance.

    • isRight

      public boolean isRight()
      Is this a Right-Either instance?
      Returns:
      Whether this is a Right-Either instance.

    • fromLeft

      public L fromLeft()
      Attempts to get the Left value. If this is not a Left-Either instance, the operation will throw a NoSuchElementException.
      Returns:
      The Left value, if applicable.

    • fromRight

      public R fromRight()
      Attempts to get the Right value. If this is not a Right-Either instance, the operation will throw a NoSuchElementException.
      Returns:
      The Right value, if applicable.
